author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Kyle Penney Named Two-Time Captain of Cornell Men’s Hockey
text:
Kyle Penney Named Two-Time Captain of Cornell Men’s Hockey
Kyle Penney has been named captain of the Cornell men's hockey team for the 2024-25 season, making him the seventh player under head coach Mike Schafer to achieve this honor twice. Schaffer praised Penney for his work ethic, leadership, and ability to connect with teammates across all classes. Joining him in leadership roles are senior defensemen Hank Kempf and Tim Rego, along with senior forward Jack O'Leary, who will serve as alternate captains. O'Leary is also recognized as the second player in Cornell history to hold the alternate captain title in consecutive seasons. The team's campaign kicks off with a scrimmage against Princeton on October 19.By the Numbers
- Kyle Penney becomes only the 14th player in Cornell’s history to serve as a two-time captain.
- Jack O'Leary is the second alternate captain in Cornell's history to be appointed in consecutive seasons.
- Cornell's hockey season starts with a scrimmage against Princeton on October 19.
- Fans can purchase season tickets for the upcoming games, with more information available at bigredtix.com.
The
Big Red will also face the University of Toronto in an exhibition match on October 26 before officially beginning their season against North Dakota on November 1.
With seasoned leadership and strong player dynamics, Cornell men's hockey aims for a successful season under the guidance of a well-respected captain and a committed leadership team.
